p: In vitro anthelmintic activity was measured by the ability of extracts to paralyze and kill the experimental worms. The results of anthelmintic activity are given in Table 2. The effects were implicated for five different extract concentrations and it is clear from the result that all the extracts showed anthelmintic activity in a concentration-dependent manner. The lowest time for paralysis (2.95 ± 0.13 min) and time of death (3.96 ± 0.05 min) were recorded for LsFME at 50 mg/mL concentration. At 50 mg/mL extract concentration, the CfFME required 3.27 ± 0.13 min to paralyze the worms and 4.46 ± 0.05 min to kill the worms. Besides, the DrFME showed its paralysis effect at 3.55 ± 0.15 min and killing effect at 4.78 ± 0.30 min of extract administration. In contrast, the positive control (Levamisole) paralyzed the worms at 4.26 ± 0.13 min and killed them at 7.15 ± 0.18 min at its 1 mg/mL concentration while there was no sign of paralysis and death in the negative control (distilled water).
